Name: Statue of Eirenaios, a Priest
Description: The statue depicts Eirenaios, a priest who held the position of protector, or "Prostates," of the Soknopaio Nesos temple. Sculpted in black basalt, the priest stands on a base in the traditional Egyptian pose.He wears a three-part vestment. His hair is short and the nose is large. The head is slightly damaged, along with the chin, the right cheek, and a part of the neck. Down the center of his body, a dedicatory inscription is engraved along the legs and the feet. It reads, "Eirenaios junior, son of Pisois Prostates (protector) of Soknopaios, the great god."
